ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a deep understanding of some of the most influential literary works in the Western Canon. My knowledge of the impact and importance of language and word choice was reinforced, and it was very interesting seeing the themes that came up over and over in the works we read. The historical background on the works was also very helpful in understanding their importance. I also improved my close reading skills.
I developed close reading and analytical literary skills in this course, as well as how to write an effective literary analysis paper.
I learned to read more analytically and write more precisely in my essays.
I improved my writing skills and ability to analyze literary texts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course felt very surface level and the experience of spending hours upon hours reading some works (esp. The Iliad and the Odyssey) only to talk about them for like a couple hours was definitely underwhelming. However, you definitely will walk out of the class recognising more themes and references in the western cannon so it works great as a crash course.

I greatly enjoyed this course and the discussions we had. The works we read were all very interesting and engaging, and I liked that we spent a good amount of time on each. I also liked that our section had a good mixture of lecture/information and very lively discussion.
There is a lot of material to cover, but in general this course was very interesting and stimulating with the different books we read. I wish that there could have been more female authors though.

Strengths: readings and lectures
Weaknesses: the pace of the class

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this course to another student. The works read are very interesting and make you think a lot about life and see the beauty in little things. The works were also very captivating and fun to read.
I would recommend this course if they are passionate about literature and close reading.
Yes - it is a great introduction to Western literature.
Yes, it is a good introduction to several influential literary works.
